thread.title: Sunday's Portland Marathon means delays, lane closures on downtown bridges, freeway ramps
thread.title_full: Sunday's Portland Marathon means delays, lane closures on downtown bridges, freeway ramps | OregonLive.com

author: Stuart Tomlinson | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Sunday's Portland Marathon means delays, lane closures on downtown bridges, freeway ramps
text:
The Portland Marathon is scheduled to be run Sunday morning across bridges and along roadways through the city, prompting lane closures and delays.
Multnomah County will close several Willamette bridges it maintains, and the Oregon Department of Transportation will close several freeway exits and the St. Johns Bridge, officials say. Numerous other roads will also see delays and closures.
The affected bridges, ramps include:
Broadway Bridge: The single eastbound lane on the bridge and the southbound
Portland Marathon map, 2015. Portland Marathon lane onto the NW Broadway ramp will be closed from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. to all traffic except the Portland Streetcar. The bridge's westbound lane and bridge sidewalks will remain open. County spokesman Mike Pullen said the bridge's lift span will not go up for river traffic between 5 a.m. and 3 p.m.
Burnside Bridge: All westbound traffic lanes will close from 6 to 8:45 a.m. but will be open for TriMet buses. The eastbound lanes, sidewalks and bicycle lanes will remain open.
Morrison Bridge: The bridge's westbound ramp from Interstate 5 will be closed. The westbound traffic lanes will be open but subject to delays from 6:30 to 8:45 a.m. Eastbound lanes and the onramp to Interstates 5 and 84 will remain open as will bridge sidewalks.
St. Johns Bridge: One lane will be open in both directions for traffic between 5 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. Also, North Bridge Avenue and the U.S. 30 westbound left turn onto Bridge Avenue will be closed during the same period. Traffic will be able to reach U.S. 30 and the St. Johns Bridge from the north side of Bridge Avenue.
Freeway ramps: I-5 northbound exit 302C to North Greeley Avenue will be closed between 5 a.m. and 2 p.m. On Interstate 405 northbound, exit 1B to Southwest 4th Avenue will be closed between 5 and 8:30 a.m.
A complete list of street and road closures can be found on the Portland Marathon's road closure list online.
Officials said the best way to cross the Willamette during the marathon include the Fremont, Hawthorne, Ross Island, Marquam and Steel bridges. TriMet delays and detours can be found on TriMet's website.
-- Stuart Tomlinson
